### 2) Using the data in ‚Äôsleep75‚Äô, we obtain the estimated equation: The variable sleep is total minutes per week spent sleeping at night, totwrk is total weekly minutes spent working, educ and age are measured in years, and male is a gender dummy.

#### i) All other factors being equal, is there evidence that men sleep more than women? How strong is the evidence?

Det ser ud til at hvis du er en mand s√• sover du mere, men den er
ikke signifikant. 


Use a one-sided t-test: we are interested in whether men sleep moret han women (rather than whether they just sleep different amounts). The **t-statistic on male is 87:75 = 34:33 = 2.556**. Now the critical value for a 5 % significance level one-sidedt-test with(7066) =700degrees of freedom is roughly1:645. Since 2: 556 > 1:645 we reject the null hypothesis that men sleep the same as women against the alternative that they sleep more than women.

- The critical value for a one-sidedt-test with 700 degrees of freedom at the 1 % significance level is 2:33so we reject at the1%significance level.

- 87:75 minutes is close to one and a half hours which is not a negligible amount perweek.

#### iii) What other regression do you need to run to test the null hypothesis that, holding other factors fixed, age has no effect on sleeping? (Note that two variables capture the effect of age)

Lav regressionen

```{r}
library(wooldridge)
sleep <- wooldridge::sleep75
attach(sleep)

mod_1 <- lm(
  sleep ~ totwrk +  educ + age + agesq + male,
  data = sleep
)

summary(mod_1)
```

R square for f√∏rste model:

```{r}
sum_mod_1 <- summary(mod_1)
first_r <- sum_mod_1$adj.r.squared
paste0("first r square:  ", round(first_r, digits = 2) )
```

Lav ny regression:

```{r}
mod_2 <- lm(
  sleep ~ totwrk + educ + male,
  data = sleep
)

sum_mod_2 <- summary(mod_2)
seconde_r <- sum_mod_2$adj.r.squared
paste0("Second r square:  ", round(seconde_r, digits = 2) )
```

```{r}
sum_mod_2
```

Lav nu en F statiktik for at teste hypotesen om
koefficienter age og agesq er nul

```{r}
# q er antal restriktioner 
q = 2
n = 706
k = 5

( (first_r - seconde_r) /  q) / ( (1- first_r) / (n - k - 1) )
```

```{r}
anova(mod_1, mod_2)
```
